headline: This Amazon Competitor Is Starting To Flare Up Following A Muted 2025: Momentum Score Surges
summary: Amazon.com Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) rival Etsy Inc. (NYSE:ETSY) is beginning to stir after being dormant for an extended period of time, and this is already showing up in its Momentum score. Shares of the vintage e-commerce website were up just 4.39% last year, and have largely lagged against peers and benchmarks over the past couple of years. It, however, looks set to start the new year with some fresh momentum. Don't Miss: The AI Marketing Platform Backed by Insiders from Google, Meta, and Amazon —

headline: Exclusive-Samsung to double mobile devices powered by Google's Gemini to 800 million units this year
summary: Samsung Electronics plans to double this year the number of its mobile devices with AI features powered by Google's Gemini, its co-CEO said, which would give the U.S. firm an edge over rivals as the global race in artificial ​intelligence hots up.  "We will apply AI to all products, all functions, and all services as quickly as possible," T M Roh ‌told Reuters in his first interview since becoming Samsung Electronics co-CEO in November.  The plan by the world's largest backer of Google's Android mobile platform is set to give a major boost to its developer Google, which is locked in a race with OpenAI and others to attract more consumer users to their AI model.

headline: Samsung to double AI mobile devices to 800 million units this year
summary:
STORY: Samsung could give Google a major boost in the AI race.

The South Korean firm's co-CEO said Monday (January 5) it plans to double the number of its mobile devices with "Galaxy AI" features this year.

And it will largely be powered by Google's Gemini.

Samsung already rolled out Gemini-backed AI features to about 400 million products by last year.

It now plans to raise that figure to 800 million over the next 12 months.

The company's co-CEO T M Roh told Reuters previously Samsung will apply AI to all products and services as quickly as possible.

Samsung is the world's largest supporter of Google's Android mobile platform.

Its latest plan helps Google in its race with OpenAI and others to attract more consumers to their AI model.

One leading researcher said Samsung will offer integrated AI services across consumer products to widen its lead over Apple in such features.

Google launched the latest version of Gemini in November.

It showed Gemini 3's led on several popular industry measures of AI model performance.

Samsung shares ended up 7.5% on Monday.

Investors bought in as it's thought the company is due to reveal a profit jump for the fourth quarter later this week.

content.title: Samsung to double AI mobile devices to 800 million units this year
content.summary:

Samsung already rolled out Gemini-backed AI features to about 400 million products by last year.

It now plans to raise that figure to 800 million over the next 12 months.

The company's co-CEO T M Roh told Reuters previously Samsung will apply AI to all products and services as quickly as possible.

Samsung is the world's largest supporter of Google's Android mobile platform.

Its latest plan helps Google in its race with OpenAI and others to attract more consumers to their AI model.

One leading researcher said Samsung will offer integrated AI services across consumer products to widen its lead over Apple in such features.

Samsung shares ended up 7.5% on Monday.

Investors bought in as it's thought the company is due to reveal a profit jump for the fourth quarter later this week.

headline: Tesla Stock Gets a New Valuation. It’s Surprising.
summary: On Saturday, Former Fidelity portfolio manager Greg Noble posted a sum-of-the-parts, or SOTP, valuation for Tesla on X, which suggested the electric-vehicle maker was worth $80 a share.  Tesla was up 1.6% in premarket trading at $444.95, while  and  futures were up 0.3% and flat, respectively.  For Tesla, Noble looked at cars, energy, robo-taxis, and robots.

content.title: Tesla Stock Gets a New Valuation. It’s Surprising.
content.summary: On Saturday, Former Fidelity portfolio manager Greg Noble posted a sum-of-the-parts, or SOTP, valuation for Tesla on X, which suggested the electric-vehicle maker was worth $80 a share.  Tesla was up 1.6% in premarket trading at $444.95, while  and  futures were up 0.3% and flat, respectively.  For Tesla, Noble looked at cars, energy, robo-taxis, and robots.

headline: AI-driven inflation is 2026's most overlooked risk, investors say
summary: Global stock markets, riding high on AI euphoria at the start of 2026 may be disregarding one of the biggest threats that could spoil the party: a surge in inflation driven partly by the tech investment boom.  U.S. stock indexes, where seven tech groups ​contributed half of all market earnings this year, made double-digit gains in 2025 to hit record highs as exuberance about AI and monetary easing also propelled European and ‌Asian equities to record peaks.  Expectations for further rate cuts have buoyed bonds too, handing U.S. Treasury investors the best annual performance for five years as inflation retreated, although it remains above the Federal Reserve's average 2% target.

content.title: AI-driven inflation is 2026's most overlooked risk, investors say
content.summary: Global stock markets, riding high on AI euphoria at the start of 2026 may be disregarding one of the biggest threats that could spoil the party: a surge in inflation driven partly by the tech investment boom. Expectations for further rate cuts have buoyed bonds too, handing U.S. Treasury investors the best annual performance for five years as inflation retreated, although it remains above the Federal Reserve's average 2% target.

headline: New AI Display Uses Online Reviews to Turn Pedestrians Into Paying Customers.
summary: Intellino, a Canadian retail technology firm, recently announced the commercial rollout of Signamic, an AI-powered digital display designed to close the gap between a brand's online reputation and its physical presence. While built to serve independent retailers, the platform launches with a scalable zero capital expenditure (Zero-CapEx) model, enabling easy adoption of smart signage for growth-focused brands expanding their customer base.

headline: AI buildout's next theme will be finding meaning in other sectors
summary: Major tech conference CES 2026 kicks off today with presentations from Nvidia (NVDA) CEO Jensen Huang and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) CEO Lisa Su. As the first full trading week of the new year gets underway, what new tech themes should investors be watching for at this year's CES and beyond? Defiance ETFs CEO and CIO Sylvia Jablonski explains how she is watching how Big Tech's massive AI infrastructure CapEx spending and buildout could expand into other industries and sectors. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

Defiance ETFs CEO and CIO Sylvia Jablonski explains how she is watching how Big Tech's massive AI infrastructure CapEx spending and buildout could expand into other industries and sectors.

headline: How Alphabet’s Pentagon‑Backed AI Push and Intersect Power Deal At Alphabet (GOOGL) Has Changed Its Investment Story
summary: In recent months, Alphabet has deepened its role in artificial intelligence, winning the Pentagon’s GenAI.mil contract, integrating its Gemini model across products, expanding TPU partnerships, and agreeing to acquire clean‑energy developer Intersect Power for about US$4.75 billion in cash plus assumed debt to support its fast‑growing AI data center needs. These moves, alongside Google Cloud’s AI‑driven growth, Samsung’s expanded use of Gemini on Galaxy devices, and new monetization paths...
